word_mean: 指：手的五个指的任何一个

sentence.Network_en: Isn't it about time that you pulled your finger out?
sentence.Network_cn: 现在到了你该赶紧动起来的时候了吧？

sentence.Network_en: He claims to have his finger on the pulse of the industry.
sentence.Network_cn: 他声称该对行业了如指掌。

sentence.Network_en: He explored the wound with his finger, trying to establish its extent.
sentence.Network_cn: 他用手指摸了摸伤口，想要确定受伤的程度。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)行动笨拙，笨手笨脚

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit informal)cease prevaricating and start to act
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式)立即开始行动，赶紧行动起来

phrase.cizu_name: get one's fingers burned/burnt (或 burn one's finge

jx.jx_en_mean: (especially in a financial context) suffer unpleasant consequences as a result of one's actions, discouraging one from trying a similar action again
(N. Amer. informal)make a gesture with the middle finger raised as an obscene sign of contempt
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)向某人伸出中指（表示蔑视）

phrase.cizu_name: have a finger in every pie

jx.jx_en_mean: be involved in a large and varied number of activities or enterprises

phrase.cizu_name: have a finger in the pie

jx.jx_en_mean: be involved in a matter, especially in an annoyingly interfering way
jx.jx_cn_mean: 染指；参与其事；横加干涉

phrase.cizu_name: have (或 keep) one's finger on the pulse

jx.jx_en_mean: be aware of all the latest news or developments
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把握脉搏；了解最新动向

lj.lj_ly: he keeps his finger on the pulse of world music.
lj.lj_ls: 他了解世界音乐的最新动向。

jx.jx_en_mean: touch someone, especially with the intention of harming them

phrase.cizu_name: put something on the long finger

jx.jx_en_mean: (Irish)postpone consideration of something; put something off

lj.lj_ly: don't put retirement planning on the long finger.
lj.lj_ls: 不要推迟考虑退休计划。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 确切地指出，弄明白，搞清楚

lj.lj_ly: he cannot put his finger on what has gone wrong.

jx.jx_en_mean: make a sharp clicking sound by bending the last joint of the middle finger against the thumb and suddenly releasing it, typically in order to attract attention in a peremptory way or to accompany the beat of music
jx.jx_cn_mean: （尤指为立刻引起注意或打节拍时）弹响指

phrase.cizu_name: twist (或 wind 或 wrap) someone around one's little
work one's fingers to the bone

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vinger and German Finger

entry.def: Your fingers are the four long thin parts at the end of each hand.

example.ex: She suddenly held up a small, bony finger and pointed across the room...
example.tran: 她突然伸出一根瘦小的手指，指向屋子的另一头。

example.ex: She ran her fingers through her hair...
example.tran: 她用手指捋了捋头发。

entry.def: The fingers of a glove are the parts that a person's fingers fit into.
A finger of something such as smoke or land is an amount of it that is shaped rather like a finger.

example.ex: ...a thin finger of land that separates Pakistan from the former Soviet Union...
example.tran: 分隔巴基斯坦和苏联的一块狭长地带

example.ex: Cover the base with a single layer of sponge fingers.
example.tran: 底部垫上一层海棉条。

entry.def: If you finger something, you touch or feel it with your fingers.

example.ex: He fingered the few coins in his pocket...
example.tran: 他拨弄着口袋里的几枚硬币。

example.ex: Self-consciously she fingered the emeralds at her throat.
example.tran: 她局促不安地摸抚着脖子上的绿宝石。

entry.def: If you finger a person or organization, you tell someone, usually the police, that the person or organization has done something illegal or wrong.

example.ex: Police and prosecutors manipulated the eyewitnesses so they would finger Aldo...
example.tran: 警方和检察官操纵目击证人指证奥尔多。

example.ex: People who have fingered crack houses and fingered drug dealers have been assassinated.
example.tran: 那些告发可卡因毒窟和毒品贩子的人遭到了暗杀。

entry.tran: 一指之宽(指表示容量的杯中酒的深度)
entry.def: A finger of a strong alcoholic drink is an amount of it which, when it is in a glass, is the same size as the width of a person's finger.

example.ex: I poured two final fingers of bourbon into my glass.
example.tran: 我把最后两指宽的波旁威士忌都倒进自己杯中。

entry.tran: (因自己的失败或错误而)吃苦头
entry.def: If you get your fingers burned or burn your fingers, you suffer because something you did or were involved in was a failure or a mistake.

example.ex: He has had his fingers burnt by deals that turned out badly...
example.tran: 几笔糟糕的生意让他吃了苦头。

example.ex: Mr Walesa burned his fingers by promising he would give every Pole 100m zlotys to start a business.
example.tran: 瓦文萨先生因为承诺给每个波兰人1亿兹罗提创办企业而尝到了苦果。

entry.tran: (把食指与中指交叉以)祈求好运
entry.def: If you cross your fingers, you put one finger on top of another and hope for good luck. If you say that someone is keeping their fingers crossed, you mean they are hoping for good luck.

example.ex: He crossed his fingers, asking for luck for the first time in his life...
example.tran: 他交叉手指，生平第一次祈求好运。

example.ex: I'm keeping my fingers crossed that they turn up soon.
example.tran: 我在心里祈求他们赶快露面。

entry.def: If you say that someone did not lay a finger on a particular person or thing, you are emphasizing that they did not touch or harm them at all.

example.ex: I must make it clear I never laid a finger on her.
example.tran: 我得说清楚，我可没有动过她一根毫毛。

entry.def: If you say that a person does not lift a finger or raise a finger to do something, especially to help someone, you are critical of them because they do nothing.

example.ex: She never lifted a finger around the house...
example.tran: 家里的活儿她从来一点忙都不帮。

example.ex: They will not lift a finger to help their country.
example.tran: 他们不愿为自己的国家出一点儿力。

entry.def: If you say that someone has a finger in every pie, you mean they are involved in a lot of things.

example.ex: He very much likes to have a finger in every pie...
example.tran: 他很喜欢什么事都插上一杠。

example.ex: He's a man with fingers in a lot of pies.
example.tran: 他这个人总是到处管闲事。

entry.def: If you point the finger at someone or point an accusing finger at someone, you blame them or accuse them of doing wrong.

example.ex: He said he wasn't pointing an accusing finger at anyone in the government or the army.
example.tran: 他说他并不是在指责政府或军方的任何人。

entry.tran: 将怀疑(或指责)的矛头指(向…)
entry.def: To point the finger of suspicion or blame at someone means to make people suspect them of doing wrong or blame them for doing wrong.

example.ex: Forensic evidence points the finger of suspicion firmly at him.
example.tran: 法医的证据将怀疑的矛头明确地指向了他。

entry.tran: (粗鲁地叫别人)赶紧(或努力)干起来
entry.def: If you tell someone to pull their finger out or to get their finger out, you are telling them rudely that you want them to start doing some work or making an effort.

example.ex: Isn't it about time that you pulled your finger out?
example.tran: 现在到了你该赶紧动起来的时候了吧？

entry.tran: 弄清，指出，确认(原因、问题等)
entry.def: If you put your finger on something, for example a reason or problem, you see and identify exactly what it is.

example.ex: Midge couldn't quite put her finger on the reason...
example.tran: 米吉还不能十分确定原因何在。

example.ex: He could never quite put his finger on who or what was responsible for all this.
example.tran: 他一直就搞不清楚是谁或者什么造成了这一切。

entry.def: If someone or something slips through your fingers, you just fail to catch them, get them, or keep them.

example.ex: Money has slipped through his fingers all his life...
example.tran: 他这一辈子都没能抓住金钱。

example.ex: You mustn't allow a golden opportunity to slip through your fingers or you will regret it later.
example.tran: 千万别错失良机，否则日后追悔莫及。

means.word_mean: 1. any of the terminal members of the hand (sometimes excepting the thumb);
2. the length of breadth of a finger used as a linear measure
3. the part of a glove that provides a covering for one of the fingers
1. feel or handle with the fingers;

sentences.sentence: "I fingered my boss and found that he is not logged on in the afternoons"

means.word_mean: 4. indicate the fingering for the playing of musical scores for keyboard instruments

list.explanation: (多用于否定句)精尽微力，给一点帮助

example.en: Could anyone honestly say that we should have allowed Paris to be occupied and France defeated without lifting a finger?
example.zh: 坦白讲，有谁能说我们应该眼看着巴黎沦陷，法囯被击败而袖手旁观？

example.en: He never stirs a finger around house!
example.zh: 他在家里从不动手出一点力!

auth_sentence.content: Why not play the Tikkabilla Finger Faces activity too?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why not play the Tikkabilla Finger Faces activity too?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why not play the Tikkabilla Finger Faces activity too?

auth_sentence.content: He had his finger on the pulse of Wales.
auth_sentence.res_content: He had his finger on the pulse of Wales.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He had his finger on the pulse of Wales.

auth_sentence.content: Campaigners are pointing the finger of blame at China.
auth_sentence.res_content: Campaigners are pointing the finger of blame at China.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Campaigners are pointing the finger of blame at China.

Sentence.sentence: For example, a Colombian who wants someone to approach him often signals with a hand movement in which all the fingers of one hand, cupped, point downward as they move rapidly back and forth.

Speakers or English have a similar gesture through the hand may not be cupped and the fingers may be held more loosely, but for them the gesture means goodbye or go away, quite the opposite of the Colombian gesture
He had his sujects learn a finger maze
Worldwide people speak differently from the way they write, and texting -quick, casual and only intended to be read once — is actually a way of talking with your fingers.
You look different today, but I can't quite put my finger on what it is.
He had a finger hurt last night

sentences.en: There are five fingers on each hand.
She poured herself three fingers of whisky.
sentences.cn: 她给自己倒了三指深的威士忌。

sentences.en: How do you finger this piece?
sentences.cn: 你是如何弹奏这篇作品的?

sentences.en: The beams of the searchlights fingered the sky.
sentences.cn: 一道道探照灯刺破天空。

sentences.en: She fingered a boy friend as one of the killers.
sentences.cn: 她指出一个男朋友为杀人凶手之一。

jushi.english: What lovely long slender fingers you have!
jushi.chinese: 你有着多么纤细好看的手指啊!

jushi.english: Keep your dirty fingers off the wet paint.
jushi.chinese: 油漆未干,别用脏指头乱摸。

jushi.english: There are five fingers on each hand.
